trans-unit.source: Represents a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenManager"></xref> implementation that provides security token serializers based on the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref> configured on the service.
This class creates instances of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer> class.
There is one instance of this class for each service channel listener.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.ServiceCredentialsSecurityTokenManager"></xref> class based on the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref> passed in.
The service credentials.
Creates a secure conversation token authenticator based on the property requirements passed in.
Represents security property requirements specific to the listener.
`true` if the bootstrap tokens should be preserved; Otherwise `false`.
A security token resolver object that can retrieve security tokens or keys when you have a key identifier or key identifier clause.
A security token authenticator.
Creates a security token authenticator based on the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement"></xref>.

An `outOfBand` token resolver can optionally be returned by the method, which is used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] security processor to resolve tokens that are not in the SOAP message when processing security.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenAuthenticator> that is returned by this method validates tokens and extracts claims.
One <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenAuthenticator> is created for each class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement>.
The security token requirement.
When this method returns, contains a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref>.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The security token authenticator.
tokenRequirement is `null`.
A security token authenticator cannot be created for the tokenRequirement that was passed in.
Creates a security token provider based on the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement"></xref>.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider> class is responsible for obtaining tokens for a given <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement>.
Optionally, token providers can support renewing and canceling tokens as well.
The token provider can cache tokens if it is configured to do so.
The security token requirement.
The security token provider.
requirement is `null`.
A security token provider cannot be created for the requirement that was passed in.
Creates a security token serializer based on the security token version passed in.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer> is used for writing and reading security tokens and security token references.
When deserializing the token from XML, the returned token must be able to perform cryptographic operations.

The token serializer must be able to do enough validation to ensure that the token can do cryptographic operations (Kerberos ticket processing, X.509 decoding, SAML decoding, and so on) but should defer application trust decisions to the authenticator.
The version of the security token.
The security token serializer.
A security token serializer cannot be created for the version that was passed in.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity"></xref> based on the security token requirement.
This method is called by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure to obtain the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity> that corresponds to a service endpoint.
The security token requirement.
The endpoint identity that corresponds to the tokenRequirement.
`null` is returned if an identity cannot be created from the tokenRequirement.
tokenRequirement is `null`.
Determines whether the security token requirement is for an issued token.
The security token requirement.
`true` if the security token requirement is for an issued token; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the service credentials used to construct this instance of this class.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials> object enables you to configure service credentials as well as service credential authentication settings.
The service credentials.
